Question

Research on pharmacotherapy of PTSD has shown that first-line medication treatment should be:

  

 
 
 
 

Answer: b) An SSRI antidepressant

 

Rationale:

SSRI antidepressants have proven to be the most effective pharmacologic treatment for PTSD symptoms in numerous studies. Both atypical antipsychotics and alpha-adrenergic blockers have shown effectiveness as adjunct treatments for PTSD symptoms that do not respond to monotherapy with an SSRI. Benzodiazepines are not generally recommended, and should be used with caution in the treatment of PTSD.

Please choose an answer.
